clinical_study.brief_title: ABT Weight Loss Intervention for Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Acceptance-Based Therapy Weight Loss Intervention for Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effects of an acceptance-based therapy intervention on adolescents, to receive feedback about the program, and to learn about potential changes we could make to improve the program.

detailed_description.textblock:
Focus groups/pre-testing will be conducted to adapt the adult acceptance-based therapy (ABT) curriculum to adolescents.
Participants will attend 2 baseline visits and adolescents will be randomized to the in-person ABT weight loss intervention or the self-guided at-home ABT weight loss intervention.
In-person ABT will include 14 sessions over 6 months. Self-guided at-home ABT will include 14 mailed handouts over 6 months. Information in the handouts will match what is being taught at the ABT sessions and mailed.
A post-treatment visit and 6-month follow-up visit will occur.

primary_outcome.description: The research team will assess changes in percent body fat using bioelectrical impedance analysis.

secondary_outcome.description: The research team will assess changes in body mass index by obtaining height and weight of each participant.
The research team will assess changes in waist circumference using a tape measure.
The research team will assess cholesterol levels using the finger prick method.
The research team will assess caloric intake using 3-day food diaries.
The research team will assess physical activity using accelerometers.
The research team will assess perceptions of self-regulation using the strengths and difficulties questionnaire.
The research team will assess perceptions of self-image using the MacArthur subjective sociometric and body scales and the Mendelson and White body esteem questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in perceptions of quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: The research team will assess perceptions of quality of life using Comprehensive Socio-demographics Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in perceptions of social support
secondary_outcome.description: The research team will assess perceptions of social support using a comprehensive sociodemographics questionnaire.

arm_group.description: Adolescent participants will attend sessions that include nutritional education and physical activity education. These sessions will also seek to build skills in the areas of goal-setting, problem solving, self-monitoring, and decision making.

Adolescent participants will receive mailed handouts covering the same information that was taught in each of the ABT sessions and will include nutritional education and physical activity education. The handouts will also provide information about building skills in the areas of goal-setting, problem solving, self-monitoring, and decision making.

intervention.description: The in-person ABT includes 14 sessions that are each 75 minutes in length. Intervention sessions will be weekly for the first 2 months, bi-weekly for the next 2 months, and monthly for the last 2 months.
In the self-guided at-home ABT, participants will receive 14 mailed handouts weekly for the first 2 months, bi-weekly for the next 2 months, and monthly for the last 2 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adolescent between ages 14-19 with overweight or obesity between the 85th and 99th percentile for sex and age as determined by CDC growth charts
- Parent of adolescent between ages 14-19 with overweight or obesity between the 85th and 99th percentile for sex and age as determined by CDC growth charts
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical depression
- Known pregnancy or plans to become pregnant in the next 6 months
- Plans to move out of the area in the next 6 months
- A diagnosis of cardiovascular disease or diabetes
- Any condition prohibiting physical activity
- An eating disorder or substance abuse disorder
- Having recently begun a course of or changed the dosage of any medications known to affect appetite or body composition
- Weight loss greater than or equal to 5% in the previous 6 months
